channel.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
channel.description: Hey all, I'm working on an album as of now and I have a question about how Auxy functions. The thing is, I'm going to be putting songs from both FL studio and Auxy in the set, and I've always mastered tracks in FL with the built-in limiter (and of course with a few other things as well). Does Auxy automatically apply some sort of Limiter or any other effects upon exporting? I'm wondering if I should import the tracks into FL and add a limiter. Thanks!

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Stack the layers INHALE THE DYNAMICS

Read full topic

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
blakkaz:

use your ears.

Agh, the one thing I can’t do well xD I can’t tell what’s compressed or not to be honest. It’s really not apparent to me.

blakkaz:

Over compressing.

This I get at least. Even if it’s not obvious to my ears, I can at least see the signs of too much compression on a waveform at least spoiler

Read full topic
item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

In your experience, what sort of songs need compression and which ones don’t?

The best advice I can give is to use your ears.

TheRealJFalc:

so what would be the use of not utilizing it smartly?

Over compressing.

IMO, it’s the biggest giveaway that someone is still learning their craft.

Read full topic
item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
blakkaz:

If the audio needs compression, then yes; if it doesn’t, then no.

In your experience, what sort of songs need compression and which ones don’t? Many songs can benefit from compression of course, so what would be the use of not utilizing it smartly? spoiler

Read full topic
item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Unfound:

I’m wondering if I should import the tracks into FL and add a limiter.

If the audio needs compression, then yes; if it doesn’t, then no.

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Record, Mix & Master – 3 Feb 10

What is a Limiter? - Record, Mix & Master

Limiters Limiters are much like compressors. They both process dynamic levels in pretty much the same way though the difference is that limiters have a much greater ratio. A typical compressor has a ratio of 20:1 or less whereas a limiter usually has...

This should help explain

Read full topic

item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Auxy indeed is using a limiter as part of its EQ auto-mastering algorithm. However, if you are exporting stems, these functions are disabled. It’s important to note when mixing them.

(BTW, if you’re using FL Studio, I’d highly recommend not using Fruity Limiter for limiting, it has a lot of glaring issues)

Read full topic
item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I was trying to dig up the post but having a hard time finding it. Stem export does not do any kind of limiting / compression, “master effects” secret sauce. Whole song export does.

If you wanna keep your mix consistent, you may want to export stems into FL and treat them there.

Read full topic
item.source: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track

item.title: About Auxy and if it auto applies a limiter on a track
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
yeah i believe if you export the whole track there are automatically some effects applied. BUT if you just export as individual instruments the effects will not be applied.

Read full topic
